Reviews.Title: Defender PX301-010 Security System
Reviews.Author: PeteS
Reviews.Content: The system worked flawlessly for 24 hours. The camera showed clear picture and the night vision was great. After 24 hours the power supply for the camera failed and I'm waiting for a replacement. I still give the system a "Love it" rating.

Reviews.Title: Versatile
Reviews.Author: RS
Reviews.Content: I just needed to keep an eye on people trespassing in my backyard, I dont have a home network and I didnt want to run long wires into my house. So this system was the best for my application. The Good: It is wireless so if you have an outlet 10-12 ft. from where you plan to mount the camera, you're fine. The camera is in color (although not the best, and it has issues with green just being grey), the night vision lighting is excellent and it picks up sound so I can hear people whispering on the recordings.I can add 3 more cameras down the road if I want with easy sync up. The Bad: Footage is low definition but unless a masked or hooded figure appears, you should be able to identify them fairly easy.  I wish I could view footage online but this system doesn't have that.  The remote control is a bit fidgety, need to press a button 4-5 times before it responds. Overall: It does what I need it to.

Reviews.Title: Can't use Wifi for computer
Reviews.Author: D. Terada
Reviews.Content: Defender support did not respond to my complaint that it interferes with my computer's Wifi.  It's so bad that I have to turn off the unit whenever I want to get on the internet with my computer or iPad.  Also, the video quaility is poor and I can't tell who's coming up the driveway.

Reviews.Title: Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Margaret Ketchem
Reviews.Content: I wish the motion detector had a wider range.  However, it is adequate for what I wanted as I wanted it in case property is damaged again.

Reviews.Title: Wimpy
Reviews.Author: Eugene E. Anderson
Reviews.Content: It is practically useless. The infra red is effective out to only about 5 feet . The camera doesn't to the on-off button. The camera is always on regardless of the switch position. The motion detector delays and only comes on after the object is long gone.

Reviews.Title: Defender Security system
Reviews.Author: Nozama "Emirp"
Reviews.Content: Well where to start... do i like it? YES, it does work & it is pretty cool, i love the quad mode... being able to see four cameras at the same time is great. Yes i ordered 2 more cameras, as 2 just did not cut it. I purchased a 17 in. Acer PC monitor to display the images because the thought of trying to watch 4 cams on a 7-9 in screen did not seem like a pleasant prospect. I am glad i went the extra mile because it worked out well....i can see clearly in every direction outside at a glance while watching tv & working on the computer.OK... the product is not perfect, not even close....the biggest problem is reception range is nowhere near what they advertise...but even so i was able to work out a good set up.One thing they dont tell you is that you cannot pair one camera to 2 different recievers, i tried this so i could watch from both down & upstairs ... to solve this quandry i split the VGA cable [converted from RCA] & ran one to the 1st floor monitor, worked out perfect....now i can see all four cams from monitors on both floors...reducing the odds of me missing something. Though not perfect...I find the motion detect/auto record to work pretty good....though some cams seem to work better than others. One reviewer stated the system would not record over 30 seconds...but mine has made recordings a full 60 seconds long!... motion is the key....if there is continuous motion it will keep recording.Though a bit on the cheap/cheesy side of things...it IS one of the next best things to a very expensive set up... and it is not rocket science...meaning If you are patient & take your time you can work out a good set up to suit your needs despite it's inherent limitations.No this is not the best set up in the world..but it makes my world better....as i said it is very nice being able to see what is going on outside at night....and the NV is not bad at all,  i get four legged visitors most every night....racoons, skunks, deer, ect.And the defender watches my back while i sleep....alerting me when it senses something...now that is pretty nice.And in the morning... any activity missed while sleeping is waiting for me to inspect....yes it is something of a pain to scroll through, but it is worth it. Image quality is acceptable... a bit choppy but otherwise pretty good.The system allows you to 2x zoom the camera image too... sweet. Also....i hooked up my Defender with a remote on/off so i can quickly & easily wake it up or put it to sleep....one reason i did this is because my monitors are being shared by another camera system  [thanks to a 2 port VGA switch] that i use in conjunction with the defender.Yes there are times when it can be a bit frustrating.. like, cam 4 just does not sync up as well as the others....& as far as that goes i do not think it is a camera issue....i think it is how the reciever is programmed....in that apparently it can only recieve one signal at a time....so it juggles all four....& whichever one is in it's "hand" is the one that gets the live image....the other three will display a stale images until their signal gets refreshed, & for some reason #4 gets left out of the active loop more so than 1,2 or 3........but all things considered i think the Defender is a pretty darn good system that can work for anyone willing to work with it.

Reviews.Title: Additional cameras
Reviews.Author: Gary Micko
Reviews.Content: They work very well. Except, The most confusing thing is how to keep the camera within range of the monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great While It Lasted!
Reviews.Author: Jerrs
Reviews.Content: Defender security system met most of my expectations.  It's output was even used as evidence to identify an abusive interloper to the police. Unfortunately it stopped working after 10 months.  Ordered a replacement camera and DVR.  Hopefully either the older camera or DVR can be used with the new equipment.

Reviews.Title: Good basic surveilance system
Reviews.Author: J.Lee
Reviews.Content: Pros: Wireless - good signal strength. Easy initial configuration (basically non. DVR works with the cameras right out of the box). simple DVR operation (only a handful number of functions through a very intuitive user interface).Cons: Low resolution video image(only 640x480). Only one channel can be recorded at a time. Bleached color during daytime, infra-red blows off faces (all white) at the best distance for identification (less than 6 feet). Motion sensor may not detect an approaching object until the object comes really close (8-10 feet) if the camera is installed at the manual-suggested angle.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Kathryn C.  McManus
Reviews.Content: This camera was very good.  We had to return it because the night vision didnot reach far enough for our needs.  The packaging was great, and we got thecamera quickly.

Reviews.Title: Very limited range, no technical support.
Reviews.Author: A. Hill
Reviews.Content: While the physical installation of this system is straightforward, and the cameras quickly pair with the base if you test the system before full installation, the distance that cameras can send a dependable signal to the base is severely limited by walls. Neither of my cameras would have been more than 30 feet from the base in any place I tried to mount it outside. It was extremely difficult to find a place that provided a signalIn seeking technical support, the website is utterly useless. The website has no troubleshooting suggestions or forums. It's only resources are the instruction manual that already comes with the system, an installation video for an unrelated wired system, and a toll free number for an automated menu system that gives no more information than the manual. There is no option to talk with a person "live", unless you go to the sales chat window. Even there, the chat person will only step you through a few limited troubleshooting tips that will not solve the poor reception issue.If you purchase this product, try it out very quickly. You have 30 days from the purchase date to troubleshoot problems or return it. I delayed because I was having a new exterior electrical outlet installed. I missed the return deadline by a couple of days, and as a result, am having to make due with less than ideal camera placement. Had I been happy with the system, I was going to add more cameras to it later. But given the very limited range of the 2 cameras I now have, in the future I will upgrade to a better brand.

Reviews.Title: Good system
Reviews.Author: B. Trembath
Reviews.Content: For the price this system has great features.  I was surprised how well the night vision actually worked and the LCD control panel is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: when i bought it i thought it was a mistake and it was over rated but when i got it it worked very nicely and i am losing no more money from my cousin lol!

Reviews.Title: Cameras are junk
Reviews.Author: savvy shopper83
Reviews.Content: Video quality is poor and the motion sensor range is only about 20 feet.  One of the cameras stopped working in less than 8 months and customer service gave me the runaround.  Save yourself the trouble and buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup, Good Picture
Reviews.Author: François M.
Reviews.Content: This met my needs almost perfectly.Reasons for buying this camera:Price (hard to beat two cameras for $250, June 2013)Not reliant on internet service (our internet can be spotty and didn't want to lose footage due to down service)IR, night-vision capabilityRemote data storage (not only in the device)Easy setupThe setup was extremely easy. The cameras paired with the DVR instantly.Downsides:Motion detection - very poor (I wish there was an option to adjust the sensitivity)Not the best picture quality, but fine considering the price for two cameras.Only records one camera at a time (also fine considering the price) I'm sure the more expensive DVR setups have this capability.Overall, very pleased. Recommend for anyone that's looking for a simple solution to monitoring their space.

Reviews.Title: Good value and easy hookup!
Reviews.Author: JLF
Reviews.Content: Works very well and installation is very easy.  Picture quality is decent and intercom feature is very clear.  Cameras are wireless but need to be plugged into as AC outlet.  I mounted the cameras on the outside of the house and drilled a small hole through the wall to plug the cameras inside the house.  Very happy with this purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: D. Lopez
Reviews.Content: The quality of pictures and color are poor; every looks like blue. The range is far less than advertised and it is constantly losing the range having to reset. But, after placing the camera none of my ups or mail has been lost. So, even though it does not work very well it has stopped my neighbor thieves.

Reviews.Title: Not quite right
Reviews.Author: reggie schorzman
Reviews.Content: Received everything in decent shape.  One of thee cameras had a faulty motion detector so the camera was active all the time.  I checked the m,motion sensor inside my house to make sure that it was the camera.  After the motion detector alerted me with an empty house, I am sure.  I am hoping that amazon replaces it, because defender wants me to ship it at my expense to them, and if they decide nothing is wrong I will be responsible for return shipping.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Ryan Greaux
Reviews.Content: I bought this item with one camera and the receiver. The quality of the video is decent. The audio is also decent. Setup is as easy as 1-2-3. As for it being wireless, both the camera and receiver have an power cord included for each (so the camera and receiver needs to be plugged into the wall). The included 2GB SD card is garbage I strongly recommend not only buying a separate one but also one with more memory. 2GB only gives you almost 6 hours of recording. Night vision (infra red) works well. There are many ways you can record. The ways I use are the manual record which after about 92 MB of recording it saves and restarts another clip so you don't have one large file to view later, just a bunch of small ones. I also use the motion detector which also works decently. It records the movement once it detects it and stops recording when no more motion is detected; also saving all the files automatically. Date and time are adjustable and always seen in recording on the bottom right of the camera. In all, I recommend it for security and other personal use; the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Could be so much better!
Reviews.Author: James Ridgway
Reviews.Content: I ordered this system to monitor the front of my house/street area following a car break in.I did some research and based on the reviews here I ordered this system with two cameras. I got around to installing it today and here are my thoughts so far:Pros:- VERY easy to install. I was able to install the two cameras without any issues and pair the second camera to the system easily.- Menu and setup is simple.- Easy SD card for storage.- Wireless signal works fine.- small DVR footprint allows for simple hookup to TV for viewing.Cons:- The cameras essentially suck when it comes to quality. The system defaults to 'low res' when you install the SD card - which is ludicrous as I installed a 64GB card. No reason to do that.- Given today's very basic and good technology - the system is WAY behind the times. Graphic interface is simple to operate, yet there should be more features for the price paid.- Really my biggest gripe so far is the sadly poor video quality. With today's small HD cameras, why are we paying this price for cheap cameras?More to follow after our first night recording session.

Reviews.Title: Defender
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Works as it says - A little hard to see at night but I can at least know that something is there and can identify as well as pick up sounds at night.  During the day clear picture.  Enjoy the intercom as well.

Reviews.Title: Good to go
Reviews.Author: DRB
Reviews.Content: love that they are wireless.  the receiver can be mounted to a location that gets good signal and then a video cable can be run to a monitor.  can hook up 4 cams.  do need power to each cam.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and Outstanding Customer Service!
Reviews.Author: Hispanam
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product about a year and a half ago.  We are not sure why, but while the camera continued to show a very clear image on our TV screen, the VCR stopped working.  The product was out of warranty.  We contacted CWD/Defender division through their Website.  To our amazement, they quickly emailed us with instructions to send the camera and VCR back to them; before long, they repaired the VCR free of charge!  Most courteous and helpful customer service I have ever been in contact with!  Very refreshing!  Until someone makes a product that NEVER needs repair, I will stick with this company!

Reviews.Title: I'm very pleased with this product.
Reviews.Author: Alan D. Rauscher
Reviews.Content: The range  for motion detection is an inadequate.I would like to zoom each camera individually.The signal range is not 300 feet it's  about  one hundred and 20 feet. Even at 120 feet the signal drops out occasionally, especially at dawn.I purchased a second unit so I could have another monitor in a different room.  I could not pair the second monitor to the existing cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: David LeMay
Reviews.Content: This was easy to install and very simple to operate. The recording setup is very easy.  If you need a good one camera system this is it.

Reviews.Title: good fast delivery
Reviews.Author: lindy
Reviews.Content: great  easy to use looking to buy another camera,hooked everything up in know time ,wish i had moor cameras to go with it

Reviews.Title: It's a great night visioncamera
Reviews.Author: rb
Reviews.Content: I love this camera I can see more then 40 feet. the motion detector work great. I even add a motorized base to rotate camera and the picture was great. the monitor is very clear. I would highly recommand this camera.

Reviews.Title: "can weather any season."........WRONG!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Lott "bob40B"
Reviews.Content: Weather proof does NOT mean waterproof.  AS soon as I got this product it was very clear that there was no way in *ell these cameras would not get fried in the first rain.  Before mounting 'em outside I first caulked EVERY openintg and seam I could find (get clear caulk so the cams don't look goofy from a distance). The one exception is the sync button, leave that alone.  The first time fog rolled in the cam with the mic allowed humidity to collect on the lens so I caulked the openings for the mic.  once that was done the cams are doing very well in direct rain.  This is a bit of a hassle but well worth the effort so you can mount the cams outside with no worries.

Reviews.Title: completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: steven ward
Reviews.Content: product meets expectations and the clarity and sound are very good. The overall use is easy and it adds security and piece of mind to our home.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Product!  It works just as it should and is very versatile.  The many options on the master unit is exceptional, it lets you use the camera or cameras in the way that works best for you.  Configuration is quick and easy to get up and running.  This is a great low cost option for a high quality video system.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: R. Hall
Reviews.Content: They went up in a hart beat --No problems--The book said 100* from the baseI did hook up 2 camera's 13* from the Ground about 120* from the MonitorGood Signal great picture

Reviews.Title: Great little system
Reviews.Author: George Crowell
Reviews.Content: Camera and monitor works exactly as described. Very easy to set up. Very easy to understand instructions in the booklet. I purchased the 32 gig SD card to hold several days of recording but I'm not sure I needed that much. The buttons on the monitor are very sensitive so be careful when you move it around. The base of the monitor is very small and light so I mounted mine on a flat wooden base to make it more stable from being tipped over (screws are included for this). The camera and monitor works flawlessly. It records in 10 minuet clips so its fairly easy to find something you are looking for at a certain time of day. I would purchase this again and recommend this to anyone looking for a small inexpensive security camera system.

Reviews.Title: PX301
Reviews.Author: Awilson
Reviews.Content: The cameras of the system are fine and you get a good picture out to 40  ft. at night.  The monitor has been a real issue as I have had to send the system back for various problems.  The monitors either stop recording or just do not respond, the joy stick on one new replacement was broken out of the box but the remote was still working.  I put it in service but it too began to have additional issues a few days later.  The cameras as stated do a very good job and the images are clear.  Customer services is very poor and their refund policies are not in line with my definition of good customer service.  I wanted to return the system as I was tired of dealing with the monitors but could not because I was outside of their (30 days) refund policy window.  I would think that if the problems do not begin until the system has been in service for a few months and you are then not pleased with their support it would be better customer service to take back the system and refund the customers money.

Reviews.Title: Best option I could afford.
Reviews.Author: Claudejer
Reviews.Content: I looked at a lot of different surveillance cameras for my home and chose this set due to cost. The video quality is sd and not as good a quality as you can now get from a lot of camera phones today.The wireless works pretty well but I only get a good/strong signal within about 50-60 feet of the recording unit. The recording unit/monitor is small enough it can be hid in a closet or cabinet but does need to be within reach of a power source.The cameras are simple to instal and set up. This was where having the video monitor was worth the extra money. Without it the installation process would have been lengthy and tedious. The motion detection has a few seconds lag before the system starts to record. So if someone is moving quickly they can "get past" the camera somewhat easily.  Also the cameras field of view is somewhat narrow.The monitor will hold a 32gb sd card and I have been able to store a month of recordings on it with room left on the card.Overall, the Defender/SVAT (same company) system is ok. It lets me monitor my property on the cheap. I hope the company has plans for an hd version of the system. I am happy enough with the build quality that I would definitely consider buying an updated version of the system.

Reviews.Title: well pleased
Reviews.Author: securityman
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with my Defender's camera. I ordered black and rcvd a silver one with a different model number, but it's compatible with my receiver I have from an earlier purchase. Works as good as I expected.

Reviews.Title: well worth the money spent to keep that extra eye we all need.
Reviews.Author: Dennis P. Rabidou
Reviews.Content: For people who are unaware of this Defender wireless cam SVAT is the same CO' that makes the above, so if it is a Defender Or SVAT you are good to go. This wireless cam's are the best I have used. I have 12 cam's in and outside my house as today sorry to say we need them. Please do not get in a contract with A-T or any other Co's that want to just take your hard earned money. My insurance inspector noted the above cam's and I even got a discount because of the extra security system. I also first installed the Web-ready SVAT with a hard drive so you can view such via laptop or smart phone. One last thing SVAT & Defender do back you up if you have an issue either tech,support or a replacement as long as it is returned in what hand glove cond. And last of all Please make sure before you even think of plugging in your cam's you purchase a power surge protector APC is what I use on all my cam's and F/S TV'sRespectfullydelton

Reviews.Title: Joe T
Reviews.Author: Joe Tokarski
Reviews.Content: Very good product for price. Like the motion detect alarm, very useful. REccomend product to all my neighbors and friends as a good purchase. Also bought extra camera.

Reviews.Title: Security System
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Product was just as advertised. Easy to install and it performs up to expectations. Great picture quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very good system
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: I bought this to watch my driveway, it works very well and was a very good price. ILike it!

Reviews.Title: security system
Reviews.Author: Mr.P
Reviews.Content: This product works just as described and arrived quickly, I would recommend it to anyone interested in this type of product.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Customer617
Reviews.Content: Easy to install. Good range and quality. Product has been reliable and dependable even in some really nasty weather. Motion detection is good and helpful when trying to record long time periods without filling up memory card.

Reviews.Title: Please as punch
Reviews.Author: J. Davis
Reviews.Content: I installed this item in garage on a Wednesday, easy breezy.  Friday night while preparing dinner I noticed someone on the monitor and caught them stealing from me.  I surprised them..they dropped the item and fled.  The sheriff was pleased that I had a video to help them with the case.  Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup, poor video quality
Reviews.Author: T Austin "Tool snob"
Reviews.Content: It is easy to set up, as the manufacturer states. I had it up and running in the house, in 20 minutes. Of course that was a very temporary setup - camera on the kitchen table, receiver sitting next to the TV.The motion detecting portion of the camera was less than ideal. If I walked into the room, it would sometimes start recording when I entered, and sometimes after I was past the camera.The video quality is poor. I'm not sure it would do much good identifying somebody after a break-in, or vandalism. It's extremely blocky and pixelated - it almost looks like when corporate logos are blurred out on some broadcasts. "oooh look, a blurry guy in a hoodie just left with all your stuff" won't do me much good.It only has RCA video out, which means that you cannot connect it to most computer monitors. You could purchase some sort of adapter if you wanted.I'd like to use it to monitor my front door, as well as expand the system and point one at the back gate. However, I just don't think the video quality is going to be good enough.Perhaps with enough messing about with extra lighting, and getting the placement just right, I can get a good enough image.

Reviews.Title: Really cool
Reviews.Author: T. Ruth "Onlyloveisreal"
Reviews.Content: My son helped my husband set this up at his shop.  It is easy to use, read the directions and follow for simple set up and use.  The image quality was excellent and the motion detector worked perfectly.  The night vision is so clear, we were astounded.  We have had some things stolen outside our business so we now have a way to detect who has been taking that which doesn't belong to them.

Reviews.Title: home security
Reviews.Author: B. Edwards "njgam"
Reviews.Content: I could see all the way down my block. Great audio and video, camera held up in wet conditions no fuzzy picture or garbbled sounds, easy to set up, just read and follow instructions as printed.  I have a monitor I use with it and they are perfect together.

Reviews.Title: returned
Reviews.Author: woowa
Reviews.Content: Did not meet my expectation. Low resolution. Had to pay $15 for the return. Sent it back a week ago but didn't get nothing yet. Where is my refund? Very frustated.

Reviews.Title: Does not work over 40 feet indoors
Reviews.Author: Robert F ODonnell
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera setup based on several good reviews.  This is my first Amazon review.  Although I don't like having my first review be a negative one, I'd hate to have others find out what I did with this product.The installation was simple and quick, as easy as turning the power on basically, but that's where the good ends.  I wanted to use this as a baby monitor so installed in the kid's room about 40 linear feet away from the living room (and only 1 wall between).  Keep in mind it says 450 foot range on the box.  It worked great for few minutes, with excellent picture and audio quality for the 2-way audio, then jumped in and out of reception a few minutes later.  The signal bars would go from near full to zero about every 5 to 10 seconds, and the picture would flicker on and off.  I played with all of the settings (there aren't many settings to change), and moved the camera around the house to see if anything would help, and nothing did.  It simply wouldn't pick up and keep reception over just a few feet away.  I have no idea, maybe my wifi is interfering with the signal, maybe not.  Either way I would steer clear of this product, as just about everyone uses wifi nowadays anyway.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: luck200
Reviews.Content: I got this security camera so I can see who is at my door.  After about a month, the monitor went ghostly white.  I eventually got a hold of the Defender service and did some trouble shooting. I had to return to them because it got stuck on night vision or something. . Anyway, I had to send back the camera.  It turned out not to be the camera but the monitor, so I had to send it back. Each time it took weeks to get a response and it returned. I bought this the first of the year and I am still trying to use it. Just got a new one and now this one doesn't record.  I'm still waiting to hear from them.  It was good when it worked, but service stinks.  I shouldn't have to fight to get something to work.  Hope you have better luck than I did, because dealing with their service department is a real challenge.  Not worth the headache.

Reviews.Title: defender security system
Reviews.Author: anthony stewart
Reviews.Content: this is a great little security setup.easy to install and easy to operate.The reason for the giving it four and not five stars is the image is not very clear at least if you have to recognise features that could matter if neccesary for legal reasons.But will at least let you know who was doing whatever on your property.and also give you warning of there appearance, the night vision is good and  all in  All the system is very easy to understand and records easily, and seems very rugged to take rough handling.I would reccomend it over other systems I have tried.And as always Amazon came through for me.AND!! always excell in shipping expediency.

Reviews.Title: Good basic surveillance system
Reviews.Author: K. Maxwell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this system because we've been having trouble with our neighbors. It works well, especially for the price. It should come with a bigger SD card, since the 2GB one it comes with is useless.

Reviews.Title: Animals in the 'hood
Reviews.Author: myoho guy
Reviews.Content: Trying out this security system, I found out that it does a great job keeping tabs on the neighborhood "wildlife" (pets) that visit my front yard at night. The unit was incredibly easy to set up and the night vision is very good. It even caught moths flying by at night. I understand that most people would be buying this set for what it was originally intended for: personal security. Given at how well it works as a "pet detector" I would imagine that it works just as well to ID unwelcome (and welcome) human visitors at your door. Be aware that the resolution of the camera is not high def and the person will need to be fairly close to the camera (especially at night) for a positive IDOverall, a well-designed and easy to set up system.

Reviews.Title: Not happy, but it will suffice.
Reviews.Author: Robbie
Reviews.Content: I bought this to monitor the comings and goings of our home-based internet business. I am furious with the manufacturer/seller. The cameras are just okay. The system as a whole has its flaws.Upon receiving and setting up the cameras, I found that one camera didn't get a picture, but communicated with the system. I contacted the manufacturer (which is also the seller, though it appears Amazon is selling it) and we went though all the troubleshooting steps, just to confirm what I originally concluded. I had to pay to have it shipped back to them (no reimbursement) and wait 4 weeks for them to check it out and send a new camera. I still can't get over the fact that I had to pay to send it to them when it was defective.The camera system has been up and running for 4 months now. It works okay. The picture is pretty good, though not as good at night. Colors are not representative. Direct range is under 300 feet with absolutely no interfering walls, trees, electric line, etc.Sometimes, for no apparent reason, the system locks up (won't switch from camera to camera or record) and I have to unplug it for at least 24 hours to reset. No internal battery backup, so I have to reset the time over and over again.There are several other annoying problems, but as a reviewer, I'd say GET SOMETHING ELSE. Plain and simple.

Reviews.Title: A good system
Reviews.Author: rickcee "rickcee"
Reviews.Content: Two years ago I bought one and had a problem with the receiver. I did have some trouble getting to the right person to repair or replace the receiver. They did come through and accommodate my needs.A good system. I would consider the receiver with the LCD which is self contained to review video.

Reviews.Title: great security
Reviews.Author: John Behrens
Reviews.Content: The defender digital wireless dvr system is a great purchase.The pro,s are its easy to set up,the night vision works well even in total darkness,play back on monitor very easy.The con,s are extra cameras are exspensive,memory sd card cannot be upgraded,camera mounting bracket could be better,cameras would be much better if it had wide angle.Overall the picture quality is good.The big question will be how long this system will operate good quality on a 24/7 basis.Hope nothing burns up.

Reviews.Title: button fell off lcd monitor
Reviews.Author: Steven Jones
Reviews.Content: on the lcd monitor be careful because my button fell off for the menu select items so now I have to use a pen to change settings very annoying ....

Reviews.Title: Perfect for us
Reviews.Author: rach "rach"
Reviews.Content: We have had this for several months and it is just what we wanted. Simple and easy to use. Have not had 1 issue with it.

Reviews.Title: great product and super easy set up
Reviews.Author: waterponie
Reviews.Content: Very easy set up has alarm and has a great picture in the day and evening. It has been great for work being able to see cuatomers coming and going. If you even want to have one on a driveway at a gate it has an intercom 2 ways you can hear anyone talking to you at the monitor. Its awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Security Systen......Defender
Reviews.Author: D. Maxey
Reviews.Content: Product joystick quit working after 7 weeks. Contacted live support and they were supposed to send me instructions on how to return the product but didn't. When I contacted live support again and gave her all the information the girl said she has not received my email with the attachment for proof of purchase then they transferred me back to the original gal who I spoke to first and she said she had it.Each person was very slow to respond on chat and I asked at one time are you still there. Canned responses I will never buy from again....

Reviews.Title: wireless cameras
Reviews.Author: jill
Reviews.Content: was a great investment cameras work excellent the moniter is also awesome because i dont have to hook it to my computer lets me see activity when im not around i would definetley recommend this company to others

Reviews.Title: Defender PX301-010
Reviews.Author: Errol Pharris
Reviews.Content: I liked the LCD screen. Night vision was not what I was expecting because it did not produce a picture clearly. I found a wired system very clear  day and night (Swann or Samsung). Return was simple and easy.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We got this item because of car break-ins and so far we haven't had any more. I like that it alerts us when there is movement outside and there is a cool screen saver feature that is just a black screen, so the brightness at night isn't a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: Great Security Cameras
Reviews.Author: KATHI RICE
Reviews.Content: Purchased 2 following original purchase of 2 + monitor.Clear pictureEasy to installBeware of anything blocking wireless signalAntenna could be longer & more powerfulCaught burglar leaving our garage

Reviews.Title: Good for Quick Use
Reviews.Author: Diana Wilson
Reviews.Content: It's good and easy to install for quick use but the clarity of the camera is pretty much useless after 10 feet.  I installed it on my sister's house because of a stalker she has.  The alarm is not very audible.  But it does give her some peace of mind knowing she can look at it and see someone there and have time to react.  I had to send the first one back because it didn't work.  I'm really tired of receiving defective merchandise.

Reviews.Title: I am pleased overall with the system
Reviews.Author: Clifford Parks
Reviews.Content: Already in posssession of a Defender 15" monitor DVR; 4 cameras.The 7" Defender wireless signal does not penetrate the outer walls to the cameras as I thought it would be - a no signal occurs often, no matter where I  position the inside monitor.

Reviews.Title: Security
Reviews.Author: Russell Moulder
Reviews.Content: We feel more secure now after putting these up around our house. A bit on the expensive side for what you get. They should have a four camera option. After buying two more to complete you could buy another one of these systems.

Reviews.Title: Can't get signal, except in same room!
Reviews.Author: B.A. Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Piece of junk. Was unable to get signal from camera outside. Would not pair with camera outside an open window or even in another room. Both cameras would only pair if you were in indoors, in plain sight and close by. Very disappointed and would highly recommend readers of this review look at other systems.

Reviews.Title: Defender was excellent
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: I bought this to watch my Mother after she had hip surgery.  I live across the street from her but I needed something at night .  This was perfect for me to watch and talk to her at night.

Reviews.Title: Video could be a little Sharper
Reviews.Author: MAudio
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit to take video of my property, and for the most part the setup and installation of the cmaera system was very easy to do.  I did not have to pair the camera, and the system software was a breeze to setup.  I had non of the problems that the other reviews saw.  The video performance is OK, but the video feed at more than 20FT gets very Blurry.  This was the first of these units that I bought, and I did a lot of reading from the reviewers, I found nothing that they wrote to be true about the unit.The pictures that you see on the amazon web site is not from these cameras.  The images are very fuzzy.  Up close you get a ok image, but the color is very faint.My next unit will be a SWANN..  Dio yourself a favor buy the more expensive unit.  the camera system is better for images

Reviews.Title: works good
Reviews.Author: James E. Cole
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this system,my only gripe is that I have  32gb card and it does not delete all the way,today it would only hold about 10 recordings at 5 seconds,not what I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: good stoff
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: I now have this for three months and it works like a charm I love it. Can't say enough about it. I would recommend this product to any one that would need a good home security system

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: R. S. Elliott
Reviews.Content: The Defender system is performing very well.  It's was easy enough to install, and the monitor picked up both cameras without a hitch. Also, it has been recording nicely for me on the optional 32 GB SD memory card I purchased.  The only reason I didn't give this product 5 stars is that I was a little disappointed that I had to furnish my own power cord to reach the location where I wanted to install one of my cameras.  Defender doesn't offer extension power cables for these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Security
Reviews.Author: Marcia Faircloth "deal seaker"
Reviews.Content: We have been broken into before and now we have a business out of our home so this is something we had to do. Love the wireless aspect so don't have to fish wires through wall!

Reviews.Title: Killer product
Reviews.Author: Frederick
Reviews.Content: I put this out bye the car shed in about the area where the Fedex and UPS drivers park when delivering what I have ordered this is great you can talk to them and just let them know to leave the package outside for I have a dog and its easier to just let them leave the package and wait till the are gone and go out and get it.You can hear the person in the house about 40ft from the camera .I could not believe this system could do that and its clear and helps when  there is bad weather you can turn this on instead of going outside and you can add up to a total of 4 cameras this thing is great.I would highly recommend and I don't have to worry about buyers regret.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Shilo
Reviews.Content: Only problem is cannot record on both cameras at same timeI  Otherwise pretty easy to use and play back.  Gives peace of mind when not home to babysit the neighbors. I have it aimed only at my property, but can see if stuff comes over the fence!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Autumn Thomas

Reviews.Title: Protect your stuff

Reviews.Content: This product my friend needed for his business and he installed it with ease and the images were clear and on point

Reviews.Title: affordable security
Reviews.Author: Gloria cuz e
Reviews.Content: still works great, have one in garage and on side of house even though we had a historical winter here in Chicago I had NO problems with this system.

Reviews.Title: Defender PX301 Suveillance System Review, April 2, 2014
Reviews.Author: customer909
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reviewing several surveillance systems before purchasing this system. It has most of the capabilities I need for my home at a very reasonable price. I ordered an additional camera to cover the rear of my house.After installation of A/C outlets to power the cameras, setup was a "snap". Each camera paired with the monitor as soon as power was applied to them. I was initially concerned about the 7" monitor being too small but after the system was up and running, I was pleased that the monitor size is sufficient. The system was well thought out. Camera display is clear and detailed enough for identification of people, animals and vehicles. It provides operational modes to manually select a specific camera or automatically scan all cameras or display all cameras or display a screen saver while scanning all cameras in the background.My house was built during the time that walls were constructed with metal lathe and plaster (not wallboard). This, sometimes, interferes with RF signal reception -- so I have a problem with reception of one of the cameras when the monitor is in the Family Room unless I place the monitor in the ideal reception area. I knew this was a potential problem but I have been able find locations where reception is acceptable in all areas of the house.It would have been ideal if the manufacturer had a repeater or signal multiplier for this purpose -- but they don't.This is great system, especially at its price.I recommend this system to all that don't have houses with metal lathe and plaster wall construction.

Reviews.Author: Rev. TomCat "Tom"
Reviews.Content: This was the second security recording camera set  I have purchased. The camera is relatively clear and has many features.It has already been used in a police investigation. Night time in unlighted areas are hard to distinguish but lighted areasare somewhat clear. Could be just a little more clear. Records up to about 40 feet. Motion sensitive, I purchased a 32 gbchip for recording, last more than a week. I can see things or people about 100 yards away but faces are not distinguishable.Good set for the price.

Reviews.Author: Pamela C. Chesnas
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with this camera system. Easy setup. We simply plugged in the cameras and turned on the monitor. Each camera is placed outside, about 60 feet from the monitor.  Signal is strong, picture is excellent for the price. Comes with an SD card, however we replaced it with a 16gb so that we may keep more recorded footage. It records on the slightest motion detection, including shadows moving in our driveway.  Overall, for a home owner looking for an added bit of security, this is an excellent choice.  Note: These are not IP cameras and you cannot view them from a mobile device or computer.

Reviews.Author: Reggie R.
Reviews.Content: Good Product. I had it up and running with in an hour.Only thing I did not like about the cameras is the reflection from the inferred on windows. It could use some kind of control on the motions sensors. If the winds blows, and movement of the tree branches or snow blowing by the windows will set off the alarm. It claims to be weather proof, but the specifications say that it will not work outside under 14 degrees. Reviews.Content: So far so good.  For the price it is great, I wish for a solar wireless system but it would be much more expensive I imagine.  I will be buying additional add on cameras every week since it holds up to 4.  Highly recommend the 32GB SD card which holds 2 days at the best quality.

Reviews.Author: BlackGravity
Reviews.Content: this took me all of 10 minuets to set up,powered everything and plugged in and i was good to go,i mounted this to watch my front door outside,and it's going through 2 walls and i still have 4 bars on the signal,the camera isn't crystal clear but i definitely can recognize who's at my door.the intercom works extremely well.i haven't yet been able to see how this works at night,but the colors show up OK and i will be ordering additional cameras,maybe 2 more.. this is a must have.

Reviews.Title: Gret!!!

Reviews.Content: Great security system!!! I got several before and this one is the best. Very easy to operate and install!!!Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: Good, but not good Range

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install, Good Quality
Reviews.Author: Jeff Hoagland
Reviews.Content: I bought this to keep an eye on the cars in my driveway because of neighborhood thefts. Motion recording works great and the recording to a SD card makes viewing very easy on the device (attached to a TV) or on a PC.Since I installed the camera under an overhang on the house, I would have liked to have a bracket that allowed installation from the top of the camera rather than the only the side or bottom, but it still works fine.Also, I would like to have a slightly wider view. The distance is about 20 feet from the roof down to the driveway, and the angle is barely wide enough to see both sides of each car.

Reviews.Title: Just what we were looking for
Reviews.Author: Deedee
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I purchased this. I am not disappointed - easy to install, easy to use. It has a wide range of coverage and the night vision is great.

Reviews.Title: A good buy
Reviews.Author: S. A. Morse "So Cal girl 333"
Reviews.Content: This was very easy to set up and use. For the price you get the SD card recording DVR, which was a great feature for us. We mounted it on a rotor on a pole, so we can have the camera rotate almost a full 360 degrees from inside the house. I really like that you have one-button instant recording while watching a live feed from the small remote that comes with it. Or set it to motion detecting and it can record for 5, 15 or 30 seconds. Or program it for a scheduled recording while you are gone. With the motion detect recording, if it keeps detecting motion it will continue to record, which I like. We purchased a 48 LED CCTV IR infrared Night Vision Illuminator light to help enhance the nightvision of this camera. Even without the extra IR light, the nightvision built in with this camera goes about fifty feet depending on the angle the camera is set at. With the extra IR light, we get about another twenty feet and everything is lighter and clearer. For the nightvision built in the camera, you WILL see the red LED IR lights when they are on at night. They are actually quite bright and we could see them from over fifty feet away, from any angle. For a simple camera with a DVR and nightvision, it's a very good deal. The daytime color does have a slight washed-out look (no natural greens) but that isn't a problem or big deal. The image is slightly shaky, even for wireless, but again for the price you get a fairly good camera. For a better camera and better videos you would have to pay more. The only thing about this camera I don't like is the microphone for sound. It doesn't pick up sound very well at all unless you are right next to the camera, or the sound is loud. Motion detecting can vary depending on angle and the light outside. We have had it pick up motion up to fifty feet away, but had to angle it just right to get it to do that, and the light has to be just right during the day. It seems to pick up motion better early in the morning and around dusk, so natural light has a lot to do with how well it will pick up motion and record when on motion detector recording. For the price and what you get with it, it's a great deal and we already want to purchase an add-on additional camera for the tiny bit of area we can't cover. We did get a ;16gb SD card, so if we are gone for a lengthy time it will record a lot. Overall we are very happy with the camera and DVR

I called to see if they offered a different lens and they said "no". Reviews.Title: Very good wireless camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Richard k Rose
Reviews.Content: I bought this single camera to go along with my camera and recorder by Defender. I had an offender who walked out of the frame and needed more coverage.The Pros:Very clear images and sound even in pitch dark situations.Good wireless transmission to the recorder. Get a 16Gb SD card.Easy playback on any TV.The Cons:I wish the image were better, HD would be great.There is a delay between trigger and recording that lets someone run by and not get recorded clearly (but if they are running that fast they can't grab much).I wish I could delete more than one video at a time. My recorder wouldn't take recognize the 32Gb SD card I purchased with the unit. I use a 16Gb but it gets formatted by the recorder as read only so the only way to delete old vids is one at a time.Better instructions on the web would be helpful. Stationary mounting has it's limitations but remote control on other cameras has been fraught with disasters (video of the ceiling while people invade the garage).

We have a camera in our living room shooting down the hallway and one facing our master bedroom door.  The kids were getting into our room and stealing things and it was getting out of hand.  This has almost all but put a halt to the problems we are having.  It was very easy to install and I would like to get one more camera.  I love the 2 way intercom.

Reviews.Content: THE RANGE IS NOT GOOD ON MY HOUSE. I HAVE A BRICK HOUSE AND IT WILL NOT GO FROM BACKDOOR TO BEDROOM.THE AUDIO WORKS REAL GOOD. WHEN IT WORKS YOU WILL KNOW SOMEONE IS AT DOOR WITHOUT LOOKING AT MONITOR.

Reviews.Content: The Defender is what I expected it to be. I have 4 cameras so I can watch more areas at one time. The pictures are clear. I can record any area and view it later .

Reviews.Title: Exactly what we needed

Reviews.Title: Works Great!

Reviews.Content: all i have to say it works great and its easy to set up or use! Worth the money i Spent!

Reviews.Title: Well Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: david friedberg
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to install - as long as you have SOME handy skills in electrical, unless there is an electrical outlet nearby where you need to install the camera, and basic skills to be able to be able to secure the system where you want.  The system works as well as it says and is well worth the price.  I love the "listen and talk" features from each of the cameras, as well as the chirping alert to let you know when someone is in the cameras monitoring area.  It so easy to add another camera into the "loop" that I purchased a third one. My house  access is completely covered...all for under $400!!! The only negative is the camera "stem" doesn't secure tightly to the camera itself. Still working on that.

Reviews.Title: Arrived on time -

Reviews.Title: Easy set up.

You have to delete daily or format the card to keep recording.  Although it says the AVI recording will play on any computer, it does not play on my new Dell inspiron with Windows 8.

Reviews.Author: John T. Cook
Reviews.Content: This Defender camera works great and as advertised it provides a clear and consistent picture. The camera is set up outside of a car wash in Maine, with constant exposure to the always changing Maine weather. I also have two identical cameras installed inside an automatic drive thru car wash.  These cameras also work very well. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for an inexpensive security system.

Reviews.Content: this security system is absolutely the easiest system to install.  its perfect for what i need it for.  I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to go the hard wired way.

Reviews.Title: I see you

Reviews.Title: Found at a great price!

I now can see anyone approaching or leaving packages, quick enough to say thank you over the intercom.  Motion activation chirps to get your attention.

Reviews.Title: For the price it does the job...  Kinda.
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: After having some vandalism in my driveway, figured it was time to order some security.  Liked the idea of this unit being wireless, and pretty much plug and play.  Received the unit very quickly from Amazon as usual, and honestly had the unit set up and working within 45 minutes.  Overall quality was quite good, and for the price, I was satisfied.Within the first week came a real problem though.  Came home to find my camera #2 no longer working.  After some playing with power cord and swapping between the 2 cameras I found it to be the power cord (side which plugs into the wall, not the camera.)  Easy fix, and within a 20 minute call to Defender had the promise of a new cord to be shipped to me.Video quality is.... average at best, enough to make out most details, but not spectacular.  Night vision is quite clear and from a good distance.  Sound quality is actually very good when using the 2 way communication.  Monitor is a nice addition, but a very washed out screen.Features of the receiver are basic, but adequate.  (You can only record 1 screen at a time.)  I also wish there was a way to dim the screen since it sits next to my bed, even on the lowest brightness it is blinding.  (Ended up covering screen with a towel while I slept.)Overall I am very satisfied with my unit, and a strong recommendation for others looking for a plug and play setup.

Reviews.Author: Glen Sasaki
Reviews.Content: Wanted a wireless door video intercom and this seemed to fit the need, plus added value with DVR capability.  More after we field test the unit.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: AZ94
Reviews.Content: I opted to purchase this camera due to the fact that it could be used without a dedicated, bulky recorder and only needed an SD card.  That was the only positive I see for this system.  The video, even when set at the highest quality setting, is very grainy and does not provide detailed video at all.  I would correlate it to convenience store footage in the 1980s.  I also have the recorder set to record all the time, not motion activated, and for whatever reason, the recorder turns itself off every other day at different times.  The only way to begin recording again is to power it off and restart.  The SD card doesn't hold much video- if you set the quality to high you are lucky to get 3 to 4 hours of footage so if you are hoping to record something overnight, think again.  Don't waste your money- opt for a system with a separate DVR system or online feed.  This is not a good choice for security surveillance!

Reviews.Title: OK, could be better !

Reviews.Author: RAS
Reviews.Content: The first unit had some issues. Static from the one camera no matter what I did. And the picture was a bit fuzzy. So returned to Amazon and had them send another system. (Tech support from the manufacturer is by email and it is rather slow. They only wanted me to send the unit into them so they could evaluate it and then would let me know what they would do...)Second system was much better. No static and clearer more colorful picture. Would like a bit wider angle lens for driveway camera and better range on the motion detector portion. I had though in auto switching mode that it would stop  on the camera that movement was detected. But does not seem to. The camera attachment articulating joint locking mechanism could use some improvement. Hard to tighten to the point that it does not move. Afraid to crank on it and break it. Hopefully I will not have to mess around with it and that it will stay where I positioned it. So far pretty happy with the purchase now that I have a properly working system. So would probably buy again and would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: No 24/7 tech support.

I set the times to record and it records at the wrong hours.  When I try to manual record it stops switching and only records one camera.  Very disappointed with no one to contact for help.

Reviews.Content: I was happy with the Wireless DVR Security system. The reception is very good and I like the microphone quality you can actually speak with some one from a distance which appears to take people by surprise. It's an excellent security feature that works well for any home protection. I strongly recomend it if you do not want to spend a great deal of money on a elaborate system. The cool thing is that you can add additional cameras.

Was hoping this would work as I was installing it for a neighbor to keep an eye on his vehicles. Product was returned and looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: works decently. not perfect
Reviews.Author: angelbutter
Reviews.Content: I got two cameras for our house- one on the front door, and one on the porch maybe 30 feet away facing the driveway. camera 1 works pretty much all the time and camera 2 works about 90 % of the time. they are not that far apart so i don't know what the deal is. the monitor is about 20 feet away from camera 1 and about 50 feet away from camera 2. but camera 2 blinks in and out of reception all day and at night it looks really foggy- honestly don't know why it does that. When we just had camera 1 i could bring the monitor up to our bedroom at night, but with camera 2 i can't - the signal doesn't reach. anyways they were super easy to set up. they have decent picture quality... well maybe not in the dark so much, my husband locks the chickens in at night and i could barely recognize him at first.. we fiddled with the brightness and eventually got it to the point where if he were a robber the police would know they were looking for a white man who had dark hair and was balding a little, that he had on shirt and pants lol, not much besides that though, maybe could have drawn out face shape but not many features. also the color is weird, i was watching the video and was laughing that my husband was wearing a purple shirt until he came inside and it turned out he was wearing a white shirt? weird- oh well maybe i have to fiddle with settings more.  anyways I am in a fairly rural area and the cameras were more for my reassurance than for police reports- so no biggie. Basically something was eating our chickens and I wanted to find out what... neighbors dog>:(  and occasionally our car alarm has gone off in the middle of the night and the motion light is on and we wanted to see if it was a person or of it was an animal bumping into the car or if the car was just looney. haven't figured that one out yet- but next time the alarm goes off we will.  All in all i feel confident even with the color and signal issues that if someone were to come down our driveway and cause trouble we would 1. know for sure it was an intruder and not the wind or a wild animal. and 2. if the house was actually robbed i feel that the police could get a decent idea of who did it- we have a tiny town too so they probably already know most of the usual suspects. Overall i like having the cameras- but i probably wont buy two more like I originally intended. I'll just stick with the two. if they didn't have the signal or picture issues I would buy all four cameras and probably another monitor haha i love watching what is going on around my house!

The thumb screw mounts wont tighten enough to hold the ball joint steady. If they were hanging they might be ok, ie. with the camera below the ball joint as in an under eave mounting. That way, no stress would be on the ball joint. Otherwise, the weight of the camera will make the ball joint loosen and the camera will droop down. Lastly, the volume for the alarm would not mute or turn down. I would turn the volume to the lowest setting and it would default back to the original volume every time.There are some good points though. I found the video to be decent. A lot of reviews are complaining about the video quality but, it's 640X480, what did you expect? The audio and night vision worked well too.If anyone has a suggestion on an outdoor camera please let me know. My requirements are as follows:*Rated for the outdoors*2 way audio*View on smartphone or tablet*Wireless*Email/text alerts on motion detection

Reviews.Title: Good all-in-one security system
Reviews.Author: Bill A "Angus"
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st time working with video surveillance equipment, but I've been building my own PC's for 15+ years and installing home & car audio even longer. So I would say that I'm not an electronics/network/PC beginner nor am I a highly-skilled Pro.I purchased the Defender PX301-010 security system to watch over my driveway and cars during the night time hours. This system was extremely easy to set up - just plug in the camera and LCD monitor/DVR to suitable power outlets, turn the LCD/DVR on and it's ready to go. The included PSS software - which I intended to use to record and review video clips - was challenging to get going to say the least. I eventually gave up and just monitored the camera through the web interface. Video quality was good during daylight hours and even better at night. Motion sensor worked well and the camera only lost the signal during one time while I was testing it - and that was when the camera and LCD DVR were at completely opposite ends of my house. The camera itself seemed solid and well-built while the LCD monitor/recorder was just average in terms of build quality.With all that said I did end up returning the product due to it's video quality - it just wasn't sharp or detailed enough for my needs. To be fair the camera is only 640x480 (which I knew prior to purchase) and it performed very well for it's price in my opinion. It was more than easy to get it running (if you don't use the PSS software) and should be seriously considered if the buyer has little or no experience with configuring a home network and/or FTP servers. I replaced the system with a Q-See QCN7001B  720p camera that - by itself - costs as much as this whole system. In addition to the 720P camera I also purchased (and recommend) Blue Iris Professional monitoring software.Even though I decided to return this system in the end, I would definitely recommend the Defender PX301-010 system to others on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: Functional System
Reviews.Author: M. Meissner
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these systems. My intent is to have four wireless cameras and one receiver, attached to a 17" flat screen LCD TV monitor. Installation of the receiver and setup was pretty easy. I paired all the cameras in the house first, then went about installing cameras outdoors. Note that the cameras are "weather-resistant", not weatherproof, and the product literature does state this. For my application I was able to install cameras under the eaves of home and garage, so they will be afforded some protection from weather.The range of the cameras is spec'd at "up to 450 feet", but clearly this is line of sight with no obstructions. I located the receiver and monitor in our kitchen area. Camera 1 and 2 are mounted outside under the eaves of the house, maybe 40' point to point distance from the receiver. The signal passed through metal siding and walls, glass doors... and video reception is pretty good. Camera 3 is mounted under the eaves of the garage, maybe 80' away. Reception drops out frequently. The garage and eaves are all metal siding, so maybe this is a factor. Video does get to the receiver, but if you monitor signal strength it will be three bars, then drop to one, then it regains and displays OK. On occasion video drops completely and NO SIGNAL is displayed for several minutes. I think this could be resolved if the antennas on both camera and receiver were a little better, or perhaps provide a flexible length of coaxial cable so the antennas can be oriented in a different location. I did find that if I hold up the receiver to about 6' in the dining area near the wall that reception improves and is steady.... but this is reminscient of fiddling with the rabbit ears on a 1960's TV (some of you will remember that) to get a decent picture.My solution may be to build a little shelf and put the receiver there. That may actually work fine.Video itself is pretty decent. Perhaps not high enough resolution to read a license plate on a car in the driveway, but good enough to see what kind of car and color. Viewing video in quad mode (all four cams at once) is a cool feature, but recording is disabled in quad mode and video quality seems slightly reduced.The hardest part of installing the cameras is getting power to them. I have had to tap off external light circuits and run power closer to the camera installation, but that was not too hard to do.Camera 4 is not yet installed, but now that I know 80' through a lot of walls is about the range limit I will be more careful where I install it (and check the location first by using an extension cord, THEN do the install.)Also, I did note that video quality is pretty good and does not seem to interfere at all with wireless internet. That's a big plus.Overall I would consider the system good value for the cost.We own an older SVAT wireless system that my wife uses to check her animals in the barn. It still works but is susceptible to wireless phone and wireless internet interference. This system does not seem to have that issue.

Reviews.Title: Decent security and monitor system. Reception thru walls is not good.
Reviews.Author: Mark A. King
Reviews.Content: I bought this Defender dvr along with three Defender cameras.Setup: As others have mentioned, setup cannot be any easier.  If you're not a technical person, do not worry as you'll have no problems.DVR: The dvr recorder "box" is quite small and easy to hide.  It's about the size of a man's wallet.  It also provides an additional sensor receptor for the remove control.  The cord for the additional sensor receptor is about four feet long.  The additional sensor receptor has a sticky side. So you can place the dvr totally behind the TV/Monitor, yet run the additional sensor to the front of your tv and stick it on the front.  Now point your remote control at the sensor.DVR menu system: Easy to navigate.Camera picture quality: Good enough.  Daytime quality is good. Nighttime infrared is good.Camera motion activated recording:  Definitely below par.  If the subject (motion) is not directly in front of the camera line, the motion is not detected.  Plus it will not record the first two seconds after motion.  So if someone walks past the camera, you're lucky to get a record of the person at all.Reception distance:  Not good.  I couldn't install the dvr in my bedroom because it would not receive two of the cameras.  I had to put the dvr in a room close to the three cameras.  ie, the reception does not go thru wall well.  One wall and 40 feet yes.  Two walls and 60 feet, no.  I moved the antennas all around trying to get reception in my bedroom, no luck.If you want to put a camera on your front door, and a dvr/monitor just inside the front door or in your living room, this is a decent and simple system.  If you want to monitor and record activity around your whole house, you must put the dvr/monitor in the middle of the house, and even then you might not get get reception from all cameras.
