I really like the motion alarm/recording function which works really well! My only complaint is that I should have bought a third cam! Might buy one soon. Other than that this product is great! Also a tip, you might as well buy a 32GB SDHC card as the 2GB SD card included fills up to a little over 85% of memory if you set it to record throughout the night only.

Reviews.Title: Easy use
Reviews.Author: Lin
Reviews.Content: Really easy to install. The camera quality is not that good at night. but for its price, overall quality is not bad.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: Good product. Works very well. Night vision is very good. I use one for my room and one for garage.

Reviews.Title: Defender Wireless DVR System
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: This seems to be a very good system for the money. The camera has good resolution and the 2 way communication with the camera works well. The system is easy to set up and use. The camera is water resistant so you should use some type of cover if it will be in the open. I was a bit disappointed in the range. I have mine set up to monitor a gate about 150 feet away and it is a line of sight installation. The signal must go through a single glass panel in the front door and sometimes it will lose the signal.The ordering and shipping were excellent.This unit is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Defender vs Svat
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 cameras. They ended up being the Svat brand and silver in color. If this happens to you, they are the exact same unit except for color and markings. They are great and other than black, are fantastic. I highly recomend them not only due to quality, but found AV House to have the best price out there. Anyone, would be pleased with either one.Sincerly, S.W. GregorySecurity Representative

Reviews.Title: review of defender great
Reviews.Author: poe
Reviews.Content: I AM VERY HAPPY WITH THE CAMERA SET UP AND PICTURE FAST AND EASY FOR AN OLDER PERSON TO UNDERSTAND..GOT IT TO KEEP AN EYE ON MY SMALL DOG IN YARD. WORKS WELL, i WOULD TELL ALL MY FRIENDS ABOUT IT.

Reviews.Title: defender px301-013
Reviews.Author: eugene
Reviews.Content: the five second captured motion sensored is ok, but it doesn't stay on capatured after five second but if I set it to 15 second sometimes it stays on until there's no motion captured, and also at least there is one second also captures motion so that nothing can get away. The quality of camera view, sometimes there's flash back that you can't see if there anyone moving or not because of the light brightness. I wish the wireless system camera will be improve totally as wireless, I mean supported battery charger that last for days so we don't have to make holes or drill to make plugs and last one is the reciever doesn't get good clear view if I move the reciever inside the room the 400 ft distance is not real, wall to wall quality doesn't work, but anyway its just a good thing that in my place have an option that I can make it work that the reciever can stay outside my room...

Reviews.Title: Very happy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "PerryL"
Reviews.Content: This system is a breeze to set up, has a very good picture and all the options I need to be able to keep an eye on the shop while I am in the office.  The motion alert beeps are perfect to let me know when there is movement, and the adjustable brightness works for me, as the camera faces a sunny storefront.  Lots of features for the price.  I would highly recommend this system.

Reviews.Title: Lorex cameras & Monitor
Reviews.Author: pingpong
Reviews.Content: Lorex cameras and monitor operate as described. However, if video signal from cameras to monitor  must go through walls or other barriers, be aware of signal degradation, especially if through concrete or cinder block outer walls. The 150 ft range can be diminished significantly. In my case, through 2 cinder block walls for one camera, the range is closer to 50 or 60 feet, resulting in "No Signal" message from time to time.Also, the remote unit lacks a button for talk back from monitor to camera. Talkback requires picking up the monitor and using the button located on side of monitor.Other than these limitations, the system works fine.

Reviews.Title: Bad Bracket's design
Reviews.Author: Roman Tunkel
Reviews.Content: Briefly:I purchased camera April 16.Connection - simpleManual - easy to followImage - day/night is goodSmall problem - bracket can not hold the camera.Problem is not solved - I was asked to present evidence that camera is falling down under gravity.I created the video file 2MB and sent by e-mail.However, Amazon politely delete my attachment.Dead end.And 8 months later:Camera is SUCKS. Already dead.:(Will contact manufacturer....

Reviews.Title: Wasn't sure
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Repasky
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that I found varying reviews (most decent) regarding this device, but I took the chance, given that at the time, they were sold out (new) everywhere, but everyone had been ordering more, so I bought this one used (with the seller offering a full warranty on it).Good: The device is very easy to set up.  I was expecting a need to hard-wire a junction box in the awning of my house to get me power, but the power cord is so stinking long, I just drilled a hole into my house and stuck it through, caulking around it.  I had no trouble picking up full bars from the receiver anywhere in the house.The only problem I had was trying to figure out the controls.  Being a guy, the manual came last, but it cleared up most of my problems.Bad: The remote is flimsy and needs to be of higher quality.  It feels and pops like bubble wrap pops, with each button press.Picture quality:  Is obviously best during the day, and at night I have two 150 watt bulbs on a motion sensor nearby.  One of the reasons I bought this was because of some shady neighbors getting "lots" of visitors that stay for less than 60 seconds at a time during the day -- draw your own conclusions, and I was hoping to pick up license plate numbers, but at even 20 feet, my wife couldn't read one with me holding one still, up to the camera.Can be improved:  I want this to be an inconspicuous item in my house, so I have the receiver hidden, but near a TV.  I want an on-screen indicator as to the status of the recording setting to indicate motion or schedule.  I had the receiver hidden, and couldn't tell without pulling out the receiver to check the lights on the box.All in all, good unit.  If it holds up, I will buy more cameras for it.Note:  This unit supposedly has audio recording capabilities.  I haven't tested it and can't vouch for it either way.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to set up!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Familyflowers
Reviews.Content: This item is so easy to set up!!!  I was impressed!  It does everything that it says it will and will get your attention when it detects something.  The monitor and the cameras has very clear pictures even at night.  It will also pick up quite a distance.  I also like the intercom system that is on it.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: First off this camera is not horrible for the price. I bought this and a 16GB SD card so that I could store more video. 15 seconds of recording is about 4MB on the card at the high resolution. With that said I love the fact that I can store at least a couple months worth of motion detection recordings with the 16GB card, together with the auto overwrite of the oldest files is great. The motion detection works great. I live in an apartment complex and the receiver is never very far away from the camera so signal is never a problem. I received my camera with a crack in the back panel where the antenna attaches and the pairing button that is suppose to be back there also was missing but I did not take off any stars for those 2 issues since they didn't affect me at all since I'm using this indoors the little crack doesn't matter. The reason that I took off 3 stars is because the quality of the video is horrid to put it best. The only reason to get a security camera is so that you can see what is going on when your not there and when the video quality is horrible and you can't see much then it's not serving its purpose. I have had it setup facing my front door from about 10 feet away and from even that close its almost impossible to get a good image of a persons face, I find it bad that my $50 webcam has quality a million times better than this. Overall everything but the video quality was great but like I said, the video quality is the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: A Little Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: Hummingbirder "Don't ask for a man's soul whe...
Reviews.Content: Who is that out there?It's really dark where I live, and I kind of don't like putting up tons of security lights.  They're no deterrent because there isn't a neighbor close enough to see what's going on at my place anyway, which is how I like it!Occasionally, however, a lost soul or large critter comes close to the house, and I can't see what's out there.  I'm not paranoid, but sometimes it just doesn't seem right.  I'd rather get a peek without turning on the lights or opening the door, you know?  So, with my husband's "assistance," I installed this system over the garage door (we have a long driveway).  And now I can check when a hear a bump, thump, or growl in the night to get an idea what's going on out there.  So far, the only people I've observed are lost and find my enormous driveway a good place to stop and get their bearings.  There are far more critter sightings.  I knew there were a lot of deer, but I didn't know the same ones routinely cross my  property!It doesn't give a super-clear picture, but it's a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Video could be better
Reviews.Author: Enrique Torres "Rico"
Reviews.Content: If there would be one complaint with the Defender I would say the it's the video quality. The video is comparable to those rather grainy surveillance cameras you may have seen on your hi-def unit at home when they show 7-11 robberies etc. That said, I wasn't really expecting 1080P out of this unit, it is what it is. It lets you see what is going on around the outside of your house. It helps to adjust the settings to high quality but it is still rather poor. The unit is relatively easy to set up which is a major plus as it includes the needed hardware to mount your camera and detailed instructions on setting up your receiver and how to operate the features of both receiver and camera. There is 24/7 lifetime customer support although I haven't had a need to use them yet. I have tried it in two different locations to see the difference and there was a minor difference in the area that received more night time light. It comes with a 2GB SD card so you may want to put a larger one in for convenience,otherwise you can delete as the card holds 340 minutes. If you need additional cameras the Defender allows up to four cameras if you need more areas under the watchful, motion detector eye of the Defender.I am new to having a security system at home, so the hookup for a novice is fine I believe. If you have a business, this may not be the unit for you, as you may want a little more of an elaborate system, although this one works just fine. All in all I think this Defender is the near perfect , slightly grainy electronic eye you may want observing what is happening around your home at night or while you are away. Recommended for those that don't want to break the bank but want to feel secure.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: securityman
Reviews.Content: Set-up was easy. It gives you the choice of how you want it to record. It is not a black & white image, but will not record or show green, so a lawn would appear gray. A decent product for the price.

Reviews.Title: defender wireless camera system
Reviews.Author: R. M
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product. Don't expect hd quality video. the night vision is excellent, way more then 45 feet. The microphone is also good if you have to use it. Very easy install. Make sure the Camera is within 8 feet of a electrical outlet. the only fault i have with the system is emotion detection is not long enough. I'm getting about 20 to 25 feet. Overall a great system.

Reviews.Title: Would make a great gift
Reviews.Author: L. Maupin "drop-dead-books"
Reviews.Content: I really like this item I like the other posters wish it had more than one camera, and yet I am very happy with it. It sets up easily and unbelievably even works in the dark. I think I might get one for my parents for Christmas, as even they could set it up.  I was not disappointed in the quality picture, and was amazed at how well I could see It is a high quality item and I am very pleased

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: C. Kleist
Reviews.Content: For those worried about ease of set-up, let me set the record straight.  This. Is. Easy.Plug in the camera, plug in the base station, and you're ready to go.I've used it for a couple of weeks now, most recently to fend-off the neighborhood kids during homecoming!  My favorite feature is the motion detecting record function.  When a car drives by, or when a kid runs past, it records and the base unit beeps to alert.  In this capacity, it works flawlessly.  My only real gripe is with the night time video quality.  It's grainy, and can be a bit choppy.  But for what it is, and for what it costs, it's a great buy.  I'll definitely be getting additional cameras.

Reviews.Title: security monitor
Reviews.Author: B. Edwards "njgam"
Reviews.Content: easy set up, like the monitor, is being used independently without television or computer, night vision is clear and the camera is water resistant, as we have had a few days of steady rain.  Hope it holds up for the winter.  Very good scoping area and distance, happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, good performance for price, missing some extras
Reviews.Author: B. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am impressed with this video surveillance system.It's not fancy, it doesn't have a lot (any really) of bells and whistles, but it's also priced much lower than most of the "DVR" systems out there.PROS:Value for money.  Well made, quality materials, packaging and instructions/support, for a relatively low price.Ease of setup.  Incredibly easy.  I wanted to see how fast I could get an image on my TV after unpacking this, and it was FAST people.  I'm thinking 5 minutes or so.  Just plugged in the camera to power.  Plugged in the receiver to power and the TV, and it just worked!  Didn't even have to pair the units up, they auto detected.  Anytime you deal with wireless networking, there is potential to be a REAL time sink, or some problems, esp. if you have other routers, etc., but I didn't even have to touch anything except the power cord to plug things in.Decent image quality.  Especially impressed with the infrared capability, as it was MUCH clearer than I was expecting.  I tested in a variety of lighting conditions, facing spotlights and floodlights, facing my dark doorway entry, even facing out away from my house (to test range).  Impressive all around, especially after I turned brightness down.CONS:No networking capability.  You won't be able to access your live feed, or recordings from a mobile device or computer away from your base location.  Higher end models have this feature, but they also cost more accordingly.Still expensive, just not relative to other video surveillance systems.  If you are just interested in just a deterrent, you can get a mock camera for about $35 or so.I would probably get one model up just to get that cool "check on your house from anywhere with a browser!" capability, but OTOH, I am not that paranoid.My use of this will most likely be:1.  Monitoring front door.  I am often away on business trips, and I would like my wife to be able to be able to see who is at the door when/if doorbell rings.2.  Deterrent to potential burglars.  This thing LOOKS serious.  At night, the infrared LED's have a low, red glow that literally looks like the Eye of Sauron.  Awesome!3.  Possibly might get another camera to hook up and use as baby monitor.  Since I already have the receiver unit, it would be cheaper to buy one more camera only, rather than a whole video monitor system for babies.  Since this unit records sound as well, should work fine (EDIT: Bad idea since you have to have a TV on for this to work...I just ordered a separate baby video monitor since using this unit that way is not practical imo (no portability at all which kills the idea)Highly recommended.  Even if you're not computer/networking savvy, there is nothing to worry about here as it's literally plug and play.

Reviews.Title: JUNK!!!
Reviews.Author: GEORGE
Reviews.Content: Not an chance this is worth this money. First off i set this up and the monitor looks horrible you CANNOT change the screen resolution at all IT IS WHAT IT IS. i cannot make out people 4 feet in front of the monitor you cannot even hardly recognise your best friends face. stay away from this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Caught a thief in the act.  Was able to download video to a DVD and give to the detective to find the perp.

Reviews.Title: It is OK
Reviews.Author: David Palmer
Reviews.Content: The wireless range is not as advertised. I had picked a location, installed the camera and adjusted it then went inside and no signal. It was only about 30' away. Moved the camera from the garage to the front porch, now about 25' and checked inside and no signal.Moved the monitor around and finally found a location that worked. The next day it was no signal again. Moved the monitor about 16" and it has been working OK. I contacted the company  by e-mail and they responded quickly with a desire to help and basically gave me several "if" reasons why I was having trouble, all of which I tried but not close to what the advertised info was. I would not even consider a second camera because of the signal issue. For the price and one camera it is OK. The camera has a good range of angle and distance even at night. The sound even picks up the birds at the bird feeder maybe 50' away.

Reviews.Title: Wireless DVR Security
Reviews.Author: Pastor Sha
Reviews.Content: Because of the purchase we made for the church, there are members of the church who have decided to purchase the same system for their homes.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I just hooked up our system and it was extremely easy. Navigating through the menu was easy too. The only negative things I would have to say is, 1. The picture is a little pixely on larger TV's. I have mine hooked up to a 22". Resolution is only 640x480 so the use of a smaller screen would definitely be recommended if you want more clarity. Don't go buying a small screen though! All you need to do play the SD on your computer and it's all good. And lastly, 2. When you set it to record on "motion," it doesn't pick it up until the object in motion are about 15 ft from the camera. Even with adjusting the angle, we still had this problem, so with a 32G SD card, I set it to record 24hrs a day to eliminate this problem. Also, you can't record more than one camera view at a time... Overall though, I am really happy with it and very glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what it's made to do!
Reviews.Author: L Hochart
Reviews.Content: I wanted a not-too-expensive system to help me protect my property.  This system seemed middle of the road, not too small, and not too complex.  I had no trouble whatsoever in setting it up, though I tend to be mechanically inclined, I believe any novice in technology would not have a hard time at all in getting this system set up.  The picture on my TV is not of the highest quality, but it is very good, as I am able to see who or what is coming my way, before they even know I can see them.  It also has great vision at night, as well, and I do love the motion sensor recording option;  it has captured a few raccoons, and cats, but I like knowing at all times what is going on around me.  I bought a 32 gig SD card, as the one that comes with it does not hold very much in the way of video.  I also love the fact that I can add 2 more cameras, making the system a 4-camera system.  I would definitely recommend this surveillance system to anyone that needs a simple, easy setup, record-able surveillance system.

Reviews.Title: Defender PX301-010
Reviews.Author: JoeV
Reviews.Content: This a very good system. A bit challenging to set up securely but pretty much plug and play. Clarity is good and night vision is a plus.

Reviews.Title: EASY Security Camera
Reviews.Author: romuloxx
Reviews.Content: This camera is very useful for places where NOT WANT TO SEE CABLES IN THE WALLS ARE AN EASY INSTALLATION INTERCOM INCLUDED

Reviews.Title: Not a happy camper
Reviews.Author: Heather Anne "Heather Irvin"
Reviews.Content: It was a great product in the picture but when I got them they were scratched and 7 inch screen is horrible not worth 315.00. If they were 199.00 better but I got screwed  and looked used

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Shane B.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product because, I was having problems with unwanted "visitors" and I wanted proof just in case something happened. These cameras are actually better quality than I expected. I was looking mainly for excellent night vision, and that is exactly what I got. I definitely recommend this product for any one looking for a little extra piece of mind. This is well worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: Love the security that comes in this box!
Reviews.Author: L. Jacobs "The Rescue You Program"
Reviews.Content: I was living in a bit of an if-fy neighborhood when I got this, and we had one entrance to our house that was darker than the rest, not to mention not near any windows. Hear a bump in the night, and we'd be blind to one side of the house. Setting this up was like installing peace of mind. Loved the security, the clear image, and the recording features. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone else needing a little extra visibility on one side of the home.

Reviews.Title: Nice System
Reviews.Author: hasselaar "belgie"
Reviews.Content: I received this system to review, along with another similar systems which came with a monitor. This system is not digital an the night vision is very grainy. It is better when such a system comes with its own monitor and the image is digital and far easier to view. But, this system is easy to set-up and for those less-picky about picture quality, it might be just the thing. I find the price to be a bit high as there is only on camera and no monitor.

Reviews.Title: Not as Advertised!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What the Hell can you do with a 13 foot cable? I shipped it back as soon as I saw that mess!! Wireless my foot!! Waste of Money! Might be good as a nanny camera other than that not a good security camera. Also they did not have any advertisement videos anywhere on the web promoting this product. Some on youtube but that people made and still vague and one with music showing the product but no explanation on it.

Reviews.Title: not what expected
Reviews.Author: cujo
Reviews.Content: way tooooooooooooooooo expensive for what it can and cant do. you will NOT be able to record from both cams at the same time! good for nanny cam or for the pool area to keep an eye on kids. NOTHING more.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Quality. Do not waste your time/money.
Reviews.Author: JasonX
Reviews.Content: The entire set is cheap plastic. The camera heads wobble around on the stands and no amount of tightening the cheap plastic knob will keep them stable. The cameras do not stay 'paired' to the monitor, even at 10 feet away - in open air - with everything setting still on a picnic table.Any interruption in power, requires you to re-'pair' the cameras with the monitor for them to work again.When they finally connect, the video is atrocious. You can't tell a dog from a goat, in broad daylight, 15 to 20 feet from the camera. Which is the manufacturer's 'ideal' focal range. From more than 30 feet, you can't tell a pickup truck from a sedan (in broad daylight).All you can make out on the monitor are blurry objects of very dark, or bright white, with occasional washed out colors.Any movement is very choppy/almost delayed; much worse than the claimed 30 fpsCameras are not detecting any motion, at any range. The outdoor temp today is 85 degrees.Absolutely useless for outdoor security, even in daylight.RETURNING FOR REFUND.FWIW - from the manufacturer's website and instruction booklet :DISCLAIMERS:IR illumination range up to 40ft under ideal conditions. Objects at or beyond this range may be partially or completely obscured, depending on the camera applicationDefender highly recommends the use of an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) with surge protection for all products.Although the cameras are water resistant they are not waterproof. Cameras are not intended for use in direct exposure to water, rain or snowRecording in quad screen mode not supported. Single channel recording only.

Reviews.Title: This system rocks!
Reviews.Author: kim parsons
Reviews.Content: I gave this DVR security system 4 stars because it works great. It was easy to set up and operate. I have thought about adding 2 more cameras. I have been looking for a while, at different sites and retail stores. This was the only one that had all the features I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Does not woek as advertised
Reviews.Author: Steven Camp
Reviews.Content: This unit does dot transmit 400' as advertised. I am attempting to connect at about 250-300' and having almost no success.Still trying to find a location where both cameras can be received.

Reviews.Title: What a hunk of JUNK !!!!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Gustaitus
Reviews.Content: Such a poor system. Please don't waste your money on this.  After 25 feet all I would get is " no signal " and this was in the house. We put the receiver in the window and the camera 30 feet away on the front porch, I got " no signal. Move the camera within 25 feet and the picture was fine. Pretty sad for a system that states " Long Range ". I sent it back the next day.

Reviews.Title: Its ok
Reviews.Author: Bryant Gordon
Reviews.Content: So I can only get the Screen to show a picture when I'm about 15 feet away...  What happen to the additional 385 feet?

Reviews.Title: Great for small areas
Reviews.Author: bonnie denney
Reviews.Content: It shows a big area, but  the camera only records about one third of it. Easy to install and picture quality is good.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for the price!
Reviews.Author: Denis Ducharme
Reviews.Content: Works fairly well, not perfect, but does the trick. The night vision is good enough to see things, but not so clear as to make out critical details. I have 2 cameras running and it works just fine for what I needed it to do.

Reviews.Title: Good camera set
Reviews.Author: kt43

Reviews.Title: A Complicated But Worthy Investment
Reviews.Author: William D. Colburn "buys things on amazon far...
Reviews.Content: I'm going to give this a simple (good) review after months of bafflement and frustration.This thing is complicated.  It's a good camera, easily adapted for just about anything.  But it comes at a price.  The webcam we have at work required me to plug it in and (optionally) add it to the DHCP server.  It was trivial.  I could probably train a monkey to install that webcam, but it would require something more like a dolphin with a custom keyboard to configure it.  And said trivial webcam just sucks, unlike this one.  I like this one.But it's not trivial.  I have choices to make, and a variety of options.  This isn't quite the nightmare of a more industrial grade webcam for use in critical security.  Really, it's a good balance between the two extremes.  But compared to the colorful boxed solutions that are too simple to require thought, this is quite a bit more complicated than just pointing and plugging.In the long run, the biggest problem I had was, as I discovered, I nothing worth pointing a webcam at.  My cats have no favorite place except my bed, and I don't need a webcam watching me in bed.  My street is boring.  I have no fish.  My plants don't grow fast enough.  I ended up giving it to some friends who have a collection of chickens.  It has a good home now.

Reviews.Title: Simple security system that could be better
Reviews.Author: Arun "Techie"
Reviews.Content: The camera comes with a mount that you can use on any kind of surface. The extension cable for it's power source has an opening on it's contacts that seems susceptible to damage but nothing that can't be taped around. The monitor syncs with the camera out of the box and comes with Analog Video/Audio cables to connect to a TV. The GUI is intuitive but rather cheap looking. The night vision is terrific. The video is saved as AVI files on the supplied SD memory card and is compatible with PCs. You can add three additional cameras but be forewarned, you may need a much bigger memory card. Overall the system is easy to setup and should provide ample security for a single entrance home.
